												Horrible "narrative" experience, but it hasa very humorous English feel to it. More Monty Python than Game of Thrones of course. This is a genuinely different take on the RTS genre. It's sort of a supply chain simulator + tower defense game + rts game. You will mostly be making sure your inputs and outputs are efficient in your base area, and building defenses so that the enemy raids don't crush you. The actual attacking part of the game plays a lot like any RTS from this era, and it's almost always the least interesting part of your time with this game. Also keep in mind that none of this is abstracted. You will actually see the peasant walk from the dairy farm to the place where the food is dumped. If you put the food place (granary) to far away it could have an impact on your army economically. Maximizing your supply chain is *required* for victory on the normal difficulty in this game.YetThis focus on economy and tower defense means that this game is SLOOOOOOOOOW paced. You will spend the first 20 (real time ) minutes getting your supply chain worked out. The A.I may then throw some weapon at you that you were not prepared for and your walls will be punctured and it's basically game over as they wreck your carefully tinkered economy. You need a lot of time to beat this game on even a normal difficulty. Great value game and also a gameplay idea that you don't normally see. The closest approximation would be the iphone typeof base builder games. But this is much more complex and isn't built with any of the fee-2-play mechanics. Also this game came out waaaaaaaaay before smartphones.

												Looking for a game that offers both a great main story, multiple individual missions to test your skills at juggling both strategy and economics of your hold? Want a game that offers all that and still allows you to create your own maps or build your very own hold where there's no restrictions? This just might be the game for you.Stronghold, an older game that still holds up to the test of time.This game is one of those gems you tend to find from the older PC gaming days and it combines perfectly strategy and managment all while creating your own personalized hold, most of the time. Its main story is rather fun and challenging, and sometimes it's really fun just to keep replaying the same mission over and over to see if you can do better. It's interesting to me to see just how far the game has come, having been followed by Stronghold Crusader up to even Stronghold Crusader Extreme and Stronghold 3. To make so many games off this says something and while I haven't the chance to play the other games, I can see why there are so many sequels. It's a great managment game that puts you back in time to where knights roamed and Kings ruled.Back when I found this game I was skeptical, but I the older graphics and play style reminded me of other games I loved so I gave it a shot and well here I am reviewing it! 10/10 "can't place that there m'lord"

												Just seeing the title Stronghold brings back wonderful memories of playing for hours going through the 3 main game modes Military and Economic Modes, where in military campaign you build up your base, plan your defenses, assemble your army and take the fight to your enemies which come in the form of the evil enemy lords known as the Rat, the Snake, the Pig and the Wolf. Slowly after each mission you claim back the terrotories stole by these enemy lords till you have reclaimed all the lands taken by the them. Also in the military mode you have the chance to be on both sides of and invasion or a seige, where you can par take in some of the most well known seiges and invasions in the middle ages. Also in economic campaign you have go through missions reaching economic goals whilst defending off the effects of disease, famine and the continuing skirmishes made by the enemy troops trying to thwart your efforts. Finally the last mode is the Free Build where you can build up your ideal castle in peace and in a number of pleasent surroundings.Overall it is my most favourite game from my early gaming years and I can't recommend it enough to people enjoy a great strategy game but this is better than the original game as it is now in HD.
